gurmukhi: ਕੳੁਡਾ ਪੈਸਾ ਰੁਪੲੀਅਾ ਸੁਨੲੀਅਾ ਕੋ ਬਨਜ ਕਰੈ ਰਤਨ ਪਾਰਖੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਜੳੁਹਰੀ ਕਹਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Kaudaa Paisaa Roupaeeaa Sounaeeaa Ko Banaj Karai , Ratan Paarakhu Hoi Jauharee Kahaavaee ?
translation: Just as one starts dealing in shells in the beginning, then in money, gold coins and then becomes evaluator of diamonds and precious stones. He is then called a jeweller.

gurmukhi: ਜੳੁਹਰੀ ਕਹਾੲਿ ਪੁਨ ਕੳੁਡਾ ਕੋ ਬਨਜੁ ਕਰੈ ਪੰਚ ਪਰਵਾਨ ਮੈ ਪਤਸਿਟਾ ਘਟਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jauharee Kahaai Poun Kaudaa Ko Banaju Karai , Panch Paravaan Mai Patasitaa Ghataavaee ?
translation: But after becoming famous as a jeweller, one starts dealing in shells, he loses his respect among the elite people.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਕੋ ਸੇਵਕ ਹੁੲਿ ਲੋਕ ਪਰਲੋਕ ਬਿਖੈ ੳੂਚ ਪਦੁ ਪਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Aan Dayv Sayv Gurdayv Ko Sayvak Hui , Lok Paralok Bikhai Ooch Padu Paavaee ?
translation: Similarly, if a follower of some god comes into the service of True Guru, he acquires high status in this and the world beyond.

gurmukhi: ਛਾਡਿ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਿਹਫਲ ਜਨਮੁ ਕਪੂਤ ਹੁੲਿ ਹਸਾਵੲੀ ॥੪੭੯॥
transliteration: Chhaadi Gurdayv Sayv Aan Dayv Sayvak Hui , Nihadhal Janamu Kapoot Hui Hasaavaee ?479?
translation: But if someone leaves the service of the True Guru, and becomes a follower of some other god, then he wastes away his human life and he is laughed at by others being known as a bad son.  (479)
